instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
not power on
board power up to s0 voltage
found no voltage  at  PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG
changed <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> but no output
CPUVCCIOS0_EN = 3.3v
PP5V_S0_CPUVCCIOS0= 5v

CPUVCCIOS0_PGOOD-  <RESISTOR>R7964</RESISTOR> removed
but still no result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode to ground at L7630?
Also check <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> and R/<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
L7630 = 0.9 ohms to ground
<RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> = 2.7 ohms
<RESISTOR>R7630</RESISTOR> = 0 ohms
<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR>= high resistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I think processor gone is it ?
or pch

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
This line powers both CPU and PCH.
You can inject voltage and check which one heats; no more than 1.3V there (for safety).
